body_html:
@tfboyd Thanks for your response, and thanks in advance for your help!

Here is a gist I worked up which will show the speeds.
You just need to change the graph_path and test_image_path
https://gist.github.com/louisquinn/796736446c39875bbdbf27b605cba33f

The script runs a dummy image as a warm up then a single image. I am getting similar FPS when using a video. Interestingly the V100 performs better than the 1080 for Faster RCNN w/ Inception Resnet V2, although I expect the speed to be much higher?

Attached is a screenshot of my nvidia-smi when the warm up image is running, it looks to be idle. When the test image is passed to the model, the GPU-Util jumps to > 80%

body:
@tfboyd Thanks for your response, and thanks in advance for your help!

Here is a gist I worked up which will show the speeds. 
You just need to change the graph_path and test_image_path
https://gist.github.com/louisquinn/796736446c39875bbdbf27b605cba33f

The script runs a dummy image as a warm up then a single image. I am getting similar FPS when using a video. Interestingly the V100 performs better than the 1080 for Faster RCNN w/ Inception Resnet V2, although I expect the speed to be much higher?

Attached is a screenshot of my nvidia-smi when the warm up image is running, it looks to be idle. When the test image is passed to the model, the GPU-Util jumps to > 80%
![idle](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5274490/35126671-93719ef0-fd02-11e7-8347-b27e5ca3a0b5.png)
